Posts.Content: heidiw wrote: Wondering if anyone else has had eyelashes fall out AGAIN several months after chemo.  I lost all my eyelashes/brows completely about two weeks after I finished chemo the end of August.  Since then, the lashes have gone through two additional cycles of falling out (not all at once so I have a few spindly long lashes in the middle of a row of short lashes).  I'm going to start Latisse, but question whether to expect another cycle of this.  (My doc says this is the first time she's heard of this, but it's possible that other patients just haven't told her.) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: LOSING EYELASHES LONG AFTER CHEMO heidiw karla2sassy2

Posts.Content: May 6, 2009 03:37PM heidiw wrote: Thanks everyone!  It made sense to me that it was happening, BUT I got concerned when my onco said she'd never heard of it....
Posts.Title: LOSING EYELASHES LONG AFTER CHEMO heidiw karla2sassy2

Posts.Content: May 6, 2009 12:52PM heidiw wrote: I finished chemo (AC-T) the last weekend of August.  My eyelashes and eyebrows fell out completely in September, 2 weeks after I finished chemo, but grew back about 2 weeks later.  In Dec or Jan, the eyelashes and eyebrows started falling out again -- not fully so there were some stray long while the short were coming in.  It just happened again. Hair on my head is growing great (have a head full of 'chemo curls').  I'm going to start topical Latisse to stimulate growth, but wondered if anyone else had cycles of eyelash/eyebrow hair falling out this far after chemo?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53
